Package game

Class Board

java.lang.Object
game.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
Version:
1.0.0 Nov 25, 2020
Author:
Nikola Zlokapa

The Board object is used to represent the connectFour board.

    Board​(int connectAmount, int rows, int columns)
    Constructor two used for the console version of the board, where users can choose any size board to play on.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board​(int connectAmount)
      Constructor one used for the UI version of the board, Set to a 6x7 board.
      Parameters:
      connectAmount - value to determine how many discs in a row are required to win.

    • Board

      public Board​(int connectAmount, int rows, int columns)
      Constructor two used for the console version of the board, where users can choose any size board to play on.
      Parameters:
      connectAmount - value to determine how many discs in a row are required to win.
      rows - Value to determine how many rows the board should have.
      columns - Value to determine how many columns the board should have.

  • Method Details

    • setBoard

      Method to reset the board once the game has finished.

      public int getRows()
      Returns:
      The number of rows in the board.

    • getColumns

      public int getColumns()
      Returns:
      The number of columns in the board.

    • getConnectAmount

      public int getConnectAmount()
      Returns:
      The amount of discs you have to connect in a row to win.

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      Method used to Print the board to the console.

    • makeMove

      public java.lang.String makeMove​(int column)
      method used for making a move. First validate that the disc is being placed in a valid location, Then find the lowest available position in the column selected update the board array with the row and column and print the updated board. The result is then checked to determine if the game is over. If the game is over reset the board and print it out again. Then the move is changed to the next player
      Parameters:
      column - The column the player has selected to drop his disc in.
      Returns:
      return the outcome of the game.

    • getPlayersTurn

      public int getPlayersTurn()
      Returns:
      The current player turn

    • setNextTurn

      private void setNextTurn()
      Set current players Turn

    • determineWhoMovesFirst

      private int determineWhoMovesFirst()
      Returns:
      a random number either 1 or 2 to randomly determine who will play first.

    • findLowestFreePositionInColumn

      public int findLowestFreePositionInColumn​(int column)
      Parameters:
      column - The column the player has selected to drop their disc.
      Returns:
      position of the lowest available position in that column.

    • getResult

      protected java.lang.String getResult()
      Returns:
      return the outcome of the game, if there was a winner return the winner, if it was a draw return draw. .

    • validMove

      private boolean validMove​(int column)
      Parameters:
      column - The column the player has selected to drop their disc in.
      Returns:
      return if the move was valid or not.

    • checkBoardFull

      private boolean checkBoardFull()
      Check if the top of each column on the board is occupied.
      Returns:
      return if the board is full of discs.

    • checkRow

      private boolean checkRow()
      Check if the row the current disc has been placed in has x(connectAmount) consecutive discs.
      Returns:
      return if the player has x amount of consecutive discs in the row. -

    • checkColumn

      private boolean checkColumn()
      Returns:
      return if player got (connectAmount) discs in a row in the current column or not. |

    • checkDiagonalPositiveSlope

      private boolean checkDiagonalPositiveSlope()
      Get the location of the last disc placed (row and column), move one diagonally down and negatively till I hit the border of either side of the board ex going from (3, 3) to (0, 6) will take 3 moves. Take this value away from both my columns and rows to get the lowest position diagonal to the starting position, then go through the board positively diagonally and count how many discs are connected of the current players colour, until the end of the board is reached. Once we reach either border we move diagonally positively upwards till we hit the other end of the board
      Returns:
      return if the current player has (connectAmount) number of discs in a row going diagonally positively. /

    • checkDiagonalNegativeSlope

      private boolean checkDiagonalNegativeSlope()
      Get row and column the disc was placed in and get the lowest value of the two. remove this value from both the row and column the disc was placed in this will make sure the new starting position is the border of the board diagonal to the position the dis was placed ex (5,3) to (2,0). Now move diagonally negatively downwards till we hit the other end of the board and count how many discs in a row of the current player there are.
      Returns:
      return if the current player has (connectAmount) number of discs in a row going diagonally negatively. \
